main event: A witness observed a medium red object described as a near-perfect circle, moving steadily from west to east at 9:22 P.M. on August 12, 1958 in Cleveland, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was observed for 17 seconds and appeared the size of a dime,The edges of the object were sharply outlined,The witness reported the object made a monotonous noise akin to a controlled roaring,The object was moving in a straight horizontal line and did not waver at any time,The witness speculated that the object may have been a UFO due to its unusual movement and characteristics.
witness description: Male, educational background includes grade school, junior high, high school in Kentucky and Michigan, post-graduate college work in Michigan.
